page.title: 21Warden Park School in 2011
page.content:
Today, Warden Park's headteacher is Mr S. Johnson, with Mr R Stoneley as deputy. There are 5 houses; one for years 7 and 8, called Junior house. Downs, Combe, Beacon and Forest are for years 9 to 11. There are 8 tutor groups (they are mixed ages in years 9-11) in the houses but 10 in Junior house. There are 1,500 students and 80+ teachers. Uniform is black trousers for boys and tartan skrits for girls with the option of trousers. Light cornflower blue shirts for both genders and a tie for the boys, with a optional navy blue jumper with the schools crest for both genders. Also a navy blue blazer, also with the school crest on, these are optional in summer. Warden Park specialises in Maths, Science, ICT and Modern Languages. The GCSE results are well above national average.
Josh Wood
